column4: sorry if anyone answered and I was gone.  I have an Ubuntu box with two NICs, but only one interface is showing up with ifconfig
My router is giving me shit, and I'm trying to get my Ubuntu box to do that job.
So your router is giving you poop. :-)
I have no such program, evidently
I do'nt have networkmanager, I guess.  Should I get it during one of my brief connected periods?
Configure /etc/network/interfaces properly and it should "just work."
I think I have a driver issue.  Would ifconfig show all my interfaces regardless of whether they're configured to be used?
And dmesg to a pastebin would help too.
ifconfig -a only shows lo and eth0.  http://pastebin.com/3Nfv88Cs
And lspci may help as well.
Looks like it's only got eth0 configured.
Yeah, all I see is that realtek controller.
